column4: Whats the best (least laggy) way to connect to ubuntu desktop from windows
hence, putty/Xming  ,  enable X11 forwarding in putty
or VNC.  (run vino, a vnc server, on ubuntu)

the math is easy, basically, you are sending screen resolution times color bits times FPS size of data in a second through remote desktop.  and each TCP/IP packet is just 4K (some used for protocol data). plus a 300ms delay each packet.  so remote desktop must be lag as hell
you want to ping your remote desktop server from your client.  not pinging freenode/ me
where is your server and your client?
so you should use your home machine to ping the office one (or reverse)
but that shouldn't be fast enough for smooth remote desktop anyway
but yea.. you need LAN / fibre network to use remote desktop smoothly :P
you sure its server is located in your city?
plenty of network speed test out there.  but you wouldn't have a sweet remote desktop experience anyway
